overview:
Emily Huang is Rivet’s co-founder and SVP of Sales & Marketing, overseeing product management, sales & marketing, partnerships, and customer satisfaction. Emily’s primary focus is to continue to develop Rivet Software as a customer-centric and collaborative organization creating products to solve the real world problems faced by preparers and consumers of financial data.

From October 2003 to April 2012, Emily was the VP of Business Technology at Rivet, which encompasses all of Rivet’s Business Intelligence solutions and information delivery strategies. Emily’s disciplined approach and energetic leadership have been great assets in setting the development team’s strategic and tactical direction. She has played an integral role in helping Rivet excel as an industry leader in XBRL software solutions, and gaining key partnerships with other leading companies.

 For the past 20 years, Emily’s unique ability to design software applications that are powerful, efficient and user-friendly has been very beneficial to Rivet’s development team. Prior to co-founding Rivet, Emily served as Director of Development and Director of Business Intelligence at Esurance. She has also worked as the Principal Architect at FRx Software for OLAP, XML-based reporting and led development efforts in building integrations to various ERP’s.

 Emily is the inventor of 2 issued US Software patents (XBRL enabler for business documents #7,415,482 & Analysis of financial and business information based on interactive data, # 7,822,769) and several other pending patents related to XBRL creation and consumption. In August 2011, Emily was awarded “Annual Outstanding Women in Business” in the high-tech industry by the Denver Business Journal for her contribution in making Rivet a dynamic and high-growth software company.

 Huang holds Master’s degrees in Computer and Information Science, and Computer Assisted instruction from the Cleveland State University and State University of New York at Buffalo.

milestones.description: Emily Huang named Outstanding Woman In Business -- Technology & Telecommunications
